name: Acid Splash
description: You create an acidic bubble at a point within 60ft, where it explodes in a 5ft radius sphere. Each character in that sphere must succeed on a Reflex saving throw or take 1d6 Acid damage.

name: Blade Ward
description: Whenever a character makes an attack against you before the spell ends, the attacker subtracts 1d4 from the attack roll.

name: Chill Touch
description: Channeling the chill of the grave, you make a melee spell attack against a target within reach. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Necrotic damage, and it can't regain Health this Round.

name: Dancing Lights
description: You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10ft radius. As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60ft to a space within range. A light must be within 20ft of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

name: Druidcraft
description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range. 
- **Weather Sensor**. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 Round. 
- **Bloom**. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom. 
- **Sensory Effect**. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube. 
- **Fire Play**. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

name: Eldritch Blast
description:
You hurl a beam of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against character in range. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Force damage.

Enhance effect: the spell creates one extra beam. You can direct the beams at the same character or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

name: Elementalism
description:
You exert control over the elements, creating one of the following effects within range. 
- **Beckon Air**. You create a breeze strong enough to ripple cloth, stir dust, rustle leaves, and close open doors and shutters, all in a 5ft cube. Doors and shutters being held open by someone or something aren't affected. 
- **Beckon Earth**. You create a thin shroud of dust or sand that covers surfaces in a 5ft square, or you cause a single word to appear in your handwriting in a patch of dirt or sand. 
- **Beckon Fire**. You create a thin cloud of harmless embers and coloured, scented smoke in a 5ft cube. You choose the colour and scent, and the embers can light candles, torches, or lamps in that area. The smoke's scent lingers for 1 minute. 
- **Beckon Water**. You create a spray of cool mist that lightly dampens targets in a 5-foot Cube. Alternatively, you create 1 cup of clean water either in an open container or on a surface. If left unconsumed (by life, the earth, a fire etc), the water evaporates to nothing in 1 minute. 
- **Sculpt Element**. You cause dirt, sand, fire, smoke, mist, or water that can fit in a 1ft cube to assume a crude shape (such as that of a creature) for 1 hour.

name: Empathy
description:
You reach out with your mind towards one character you can see within range. You can attempt one of two effects:
- **Sense Emotions** - you learn the currently emotional mood and psychological state of the character, such as if they are angry, sad, hungry or bored, and you get an impression of their current thoughts (but no words or secrets).
- **Affect Emotions** - the character makes a Willpower save. If they succeed, nothing happens. If they fail, you set their mood or psychological state, as above. This is not to the point of being effected by conditions like Charmed or Frightened. The mood fades after 1 minute.

name: Fire Bolt
description: You hurl a mote of fire at a character or an object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Fire damage and makes a Reflex save. If they fail, they suffer the Burning (1d4 ) condition. A flammable object hit by this spell automatically fails the save and starts burning.

name: Friends
description: You magically emanate a sense of friendship toward one character you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration. The target succeeds automatically if it isn't a Humanoid, if you're fighting it, or if you have cast this spell on it within the past 24 hours.The spell ends early if the target takes damage or if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or force anyone to make a saving throw. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

name: Guidance
description: You touch a willing character and choose a Skill. For 1 minute, the character adds 1d4 to any ability check using the chosen skill.

name: Light
description: You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. For 1 hour, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20ft radius and Dim Light for an additional 20ft. The light can be coloured as you like. Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends early if you cast it again or cancel it as an Action.

name: Mage Hand
description: A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30ft away from you or if you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. As an Action in later Rounds, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that Action, you can move the hand up to 30ft. The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

name: Mending
description:
This spell repairs a single hole, break or tear that is no larger than 1ft in any dimension in a target you touch, such as a broken chain link or torn cloak. Alternatively you connect two pieces of an object that make a whole object, such as halves of a broken key. You mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.



nhance effect: the spell can repair one extra foot in any dimension, or one extra piece of a broken object.

name: Message
description: You point toward a character within range and whisper a message. That character hears the message whispered in their ear (or equivalent) and can reply in a whisper that you hear in yours.You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence; 1ft of stone, metal, or wood; or a thin sheet of lead blocks the spell.

name: Mind Sliver
description:
You try to temporarily sliver the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or take 1d6 Psychic damage and subtract 1d4 from the next saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn.



nhance effect: the Psychic damage and malus increase according to the following progression: 1d4 -> 1d6 -> 1d8 -> 1d10 -> 1d12 -> 2d8 -> 1d20

name: Minor Dispel
description: You target one magical effect of cantrip level in range you can see. Make a Magic Save saving throw vs a DC of 10. On a success, it is dispelled or you can choose to supress the effect for up to 10 minutes while you Concentrate.

name: Minor Illusion
description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for 1 minute. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again. If a character takes a Discern action with the Investigation skill to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion if successful against your spell save DC.
- **Sound**. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated for the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends. 
- **Image**. If you create an image of an object such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest, it must be no larger than a 5ft cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

name: Poison Spray
description: You spray toxic mist at a character within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the character. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 Poison damage.

name: Prestidigitation
description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time. 
- **Sensory Effect**. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor. 
- **Fire Play**. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire. 
- **Clean or Soil**. You instantaneously clean or soil an object that fits inside a 1ft cube. 
- **Minor Sensation**. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of edible material for 1 hour. 
- **Magic Mark**. You make a colour, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour. 
- **Minor Illusion**. You create the seeming of a trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand, or a sound that you have heard no louder than a conversational voice, at a point you can see within range. It lasts until you stop Concentrating.

name: Produce Flame
description: A flickering flame appears in your hand and remains there for the duration. While there, the flame emits no heat and ignites nothing, but it sheds Bright Light in a 20ft radius and Dim Light for an additional 20ft. The spell ends if you cast it again. Until the spell ends, you can take an Action to hurl the fire at a target within 60ft of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Fire damage and must make a Reflex save. If they fail, they suffer the Burning (1d4 ) condition.

name: Ray of Frost
description: A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a character within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 1d8 Cold damage, and its Speed is reduced by 10ft until the start of your next turn.

name: Resistance
description: You touch a willing character and choose a damage type: Acid, Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Piercing, Poison, Radiant, Slashing, or Thunder. When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by 1d4. A character can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

name: Sacred Flame
description: Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 Radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from Half Cover or Three-Quarters Cover for this save.

name: Shillelagh
description: A Club or Spear you are holding is imbued with nature's power. For the duration, you can use your Magic Statistic instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon, and the weapon's damage die becomes a d8. If the attack deals damage, it can be Force damage or the weapon's normal damage type (your choice). The spell ends early if you cast it again or if you let go of the weapon.

name: Shocking Grasp
description: Lightning springs from you to a character that you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the character. On a hit, they take 1d8 Lightning damage and must make a Fortitude save. If they fail they can't make Bonus Actions this Round.

name: Sorcerous Burst
description: You cast sorcerous energy at one target within range. Make a ranged attack roll against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 damage of a type you choose: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Psychic, or Thunder. If you roll an 8 on a d8 for this spell, you can roll another d8, and add it to the damage. When you cast this spell, the maximum number of these d8s you can add to the spell's damage equals your Magic Statistic.

name: Spare the Dying
description:
Choose a character that is Dying (0 Health but not yet Dead). They become Stable.

Enhance effect: the range doubles.

name: Starry Wisp
description: You launch a mote of light at one target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Radiant damage, and until the end of your next turn, it emits Dim Light in a 10ft radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

name: Thaumaturgy
description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time. 
- **Altered Eyes**. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute. 
- **Booming Voice**. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on Intimidation checks. 
- **Fire Play**. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute. 
- **Invisible Hand**. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut. 
- **Phantom Sound**. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers. 
- **Tremors**. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

name: Thorn Whip
materials: the stem of a plant with thorns
description: You create a vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command toward a character in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 Piercing damage, and if it is Large or smaller, you can pull it up to 10ft closer to you.

name: Thunderclap
description: Each character in a 5ft radius around you must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or take 1d6 Thunder damage. The spell's thunderous sound can be heard up to 100ft away.

name: Toll the Dead
description: You point at one character you can see within range, and the single chime of a dolorous bell is audible from above the character. They must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or take 1d8 Necrotic damage. If the character is missing any of its Health, it instead takes 1d12 Necrotic damage.

name: True Strike
materials: a weapon with which you have proficiency and that is worth 1+ CP
description:
Guided by a flash of magical foresight, you make one weapon attack with the weapon used in the spell's casting. The attack uses your Magic Statistic for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Accuracy, Strength or Dexterity. In addition to the weapon's normal damage, the attack deals 1d6 Force damage.

Enhance effect: the attack deals 1 extra die of Force damage.

name: Vicious Mockery
description: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one character you can see or hear within range. If the character has -3 or N/A Intelligence, the spell fails. The target must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or take 1d6 Psychic damage and have Disadvantage on the next attack it makes before the end of the Round.

name: Word of Decay
description: You utter a fell word, and decaying power erupts from you. Each character of your choice that you can see within range of you must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or take 1d6 necrotic damage.

name: Word of Radiance
description: Burning radiance erupts around you in a 5ft radius. Each character of your choice that you can see in it must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or take 1d6 Radiant damage.

name: Word of Warding
description: You utter a word of power and runes of warding slither across your skin. The first attack that deals bludgeoning, slashing or piercing damage against you during the duration has its damage halved as if you had Resistance, where the spell ends.

name: Acid Arrow
description: A large shimmering green arrow streaks toward a target within range and bursts in a spray of acid. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes d10 Acid damage per Magnitude expended, and the target suffers the Pained condition until the end of the next Round. On a miss, the arrow splashes the target with acid for half as much of the initial damage only.

name: Aid
description: Choose up to three characters within range. Each target's Health maximum and current Health increase by 5 per Magnitude expended for 8 hours.

name: Alarm
description: You set an alarm against intrusion. Choose a door, a window, or an area within range that is no larger than a 20ft Cube. Until the spell ends, an alarm alerts you whenever a character touches or enters the warded area. When you cast the spell, you can designate characters that won't set off the alarm. You also choose whether the alarm is audible or mental:Audible Alarm. The alarm produces the sound of a handbell for 10 seconds within 60ft of the warded area.Mental Alarm. You are alerted by a mental ping if you are within 1 mile of the warded area. This ping awakens you if you're asleep.

name: Animal Friendship
description: Target a Beast per Magnitude expended that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the target, the spells ends.

name: Armour of Ice
description: Protective magical frost surrounds you. You gain 5 Temporary Health per Magnitude expended. If a character hits you with a melee attack before the spell ends, they take 5 x the Magnitude expended in Cold damage. The spell ends if you have no Temporary Health left, or 1 hour has passed.

name: Arms of Hadar
description: Invoking Hadar, you cause tendrils to erupt from yourself. Each character in a 10ft radius originating from you makes a Fortitude saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 1d6 + Magnitude expended x d6 Necrotic damage and can't take an Action this round. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only.

name: Bane
description: Up to two + Magnitude expended characters of your choice that you can see within range must each make a Willpower saving throw. Whenever a target that fails this save makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must subtract 1d4 from the attack roll or save.

name: Beast Sense
description: You touch a willing Beast. For the duration, you can perceive through the Beast's senses as well as your own. When perceiving through the Beast's senses, you benefit from any special senses it has.

name: Bestow Halo
materials: a shard of glass from a mirror
description: You ward a character within range with a glowing halo above their head. Until the spell ends, any character who targets the warded character with a damaging Action or Bonus Action must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or either choose a new target or lose the Action / Bonus Action. This spell doesn't protect the warded character from areas of effect. The spell ends if the warded character makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

name: Bless
description: You bless a number of characters equal to two plus Magnitude expended within range. Whenever a target character makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

name: Blindness/Deafness
description: One character per Magnitude expended that you can see within range must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw, or it has the Blinded or Deafened condition (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

name: Burning Hands
description: A thin sheet of flames shoots forth from you. Each character in a 15ft cone makes a Reflex saving throw, taking 1d6 Fire damage plus 1d6 Fire damage per Magnitude expended on a failed save and suffers the Burning (1d6) condition, or half as much damage only on a successful one. Flammable objects in the cone that aren't being worn or carried automatically fail the save.

name: Charm Person
description: You target a number of Humanoids equal to the Magnitude expended that you can see within range. Each makes a Willpower saving throw. They does so with Advantage if you or your allies are fighting them or their allies. On a failed save, the target has the Charmed condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage each target. When the spell ends, the targets know they were Charmed by you.

name: Chromatic Orb
description:
You hurl an orb of energy at a character within range. Choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder for the type of orb you create, and then make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 plus 1d8 per Magnitude expended damage of the chosen type.

If you roll the same number on two or more of the d8s, the orb leaps to a different target of your choice within 30ft of the most recent target. Make a new attack roll against the new target and make a new damage roll if you hit. The orb can leap a number of times equal to the Magnitude expended.

name: Cloud of Daggers
description:
You conjure spinning daggers in a 5ft cube centered on a point within range. Each character in that area takes 2d4 Slashing damage per Magnitude expended. A character also takes this damage if it moves into or through the cube or if the cube moves into the character's space. A character takes this damage only once per Round.

On your later turns, you can take an Action to shift the cube up to 30ft in a straight line. If the cloud cannot flow around an obstruction, it is stopped short and is dispersed. If it flows around a character, that character takes damage as normal.

name: Color Spray
description: You launch a dazzling array of flashing, colorful light. Each character in a 15ft Cone originating from you must succeed on a Foritude saving throw or have the Blinded condition for the round.

name: Command
description:
You speak a one-word command to a number of characters equal to the Magnitude expended that you can see within range. Each target must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or spend its Action this Round to follow the command to the best of its ability and interpretation. 

Example commands include:
- **Approach**. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5ft of you.
- **Release**. The target drops whatever it is holding, or ends an ongoing Grapple, and then ends its turn.
- **Flee**. The target spends its action to Move away from you by the fastest available means.
- **Grovel**. The target goes Prone and then ends its turn.
- **Halt**. If the target was going to Move, it instead takes no Action.

name: Compelled Duel
description: You try to compel a character into a duel. One character that you can see within range makes a Willpower saving throw. On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on attacks against targets other than you, and it can't willingly move to a space that is more than 30ft away from you. The spell ends if you make an attack against a character other than the target, if you cast a spell on an enemy other than the target, if an ally of yours damages the target, or if you end the Round more than 30ft away from the target.

name: Comprehend Languages
materials: a pinch of soot and salt
description: For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any language that you hear or see signed. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface on which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text. This spell doesn't decode symbols or secret messages.

name: Cordon of Arrows
description:
You touch up to 2 per Magnitude expended nonmagical Arrows, Bolts, Bullets, Javelins, Knives, or Throwing Axes, and plant them in the ground where you stand. Until the spell ends, the ""ammunition"" can't be physically uprooted, and whenever a character other than you Moves within 30ft of the Cordon of Arrows, one piece of ammunition flies up to strike it. The character must succeed on a Reflex saving throw or take 2d4 Piercing damage, for Arrows, Bolts or Bullets, 1d8 Piercing damage for Javelins, or 2d4 Slashing damage for Knives or Throwing Axes. The piece of ammunition then behaves as normal. 

The spell ends when none of the ammunition remains planted in the ground, or you use a Bonus Action to dismiss it. When you cast this spell, you can designate any characters you choose, and the spell ignores them.

name: Create or Destroy Water
materials: a mix of water and sand
description:
You do one of the following:
- **Create Water**. You create up to 10 gallons per Magnitude expended of clean water within range in an open container. Alternatively, the water falls as rain in a 30-foot Cube within range, extinguishing exposed flames there.
- **Destroy Water**. You destroy up to 10 gallons per Magnitude expended of water in an open container within range. Alternatively, you destroy fog in a 30-foot Cube within range.

The size of the Cube increases by 5ft per Magnitude expended above 1.

name: Cure Wounds
description: A character you touch regains a number of Health equal to 2d8 per Magnitude expended plus your Magic Stat (minimum of 0). This spell has no effect on Undead or Constructs.

name: Detect Evil and Good
description: For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberrations, Fiends, Celestials, or Undead within 30ft of yourself. Additionally, you can sense if any characters you see are aligned with any planar axis (Good/Evil, Reason/Passion, Law/Chaos), and to what degree (their Faith stat). You also sense whether the Hallow spell is active there and, if so, where. The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

name: Detect Law and Chaos
description: For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberrations, Constructs, Elementals, Giants, Machines, or Sprites within 30ft of yourself. You also detect the degree of the plane you are on is to the rules of the material plane. The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

name: Detect Life and Death
description: For the duration, you sense the location of any Fey, Fell, Beasts, Lycanthropes, Oozes, or Plants within 60ft of yourself. You also know if any corpses or new life is less than a day old. The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

name: Detect Magic
description: For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30ft of yourself. You see a faint aura around any visible character or object in the area that bears magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

name: Detect Poison and Disease
description: For the duration, you sense the location of poisons, poisonous or venomous creatures, and magical contagions within 30ft of yourself. You sense the kind of poison, creature, or contagion in each case.The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

name: Detect Reason and Passion
description: For the duration, you sense the location of any Demons, Dragons, Jurors, or Monstrosities, within 30ft of yourself. When you cast the spell you can also specify two races of Humanoid to detect. You also sense whether the Hallow spell is active there and, if so, where. The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

name: Disguise Self
description:
You make yourself, including your clothing, armour, weapons, and other belongings on your person, look different until the spell ends. You can seem 2ft shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

A character can take the Discern action to inspect your appearance to see through the illusion, and must succeed on an Investigation check against your spell save DC.

name: Dispel Magic
description: Choose one character, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of a Magnitude lower than the Magnitude expended on the target ends. If the Magnitudes are equal, make a Magic Save vs a DC of 10 + the Magnitude. If you succeed, the ongoing spell on the target ends. Dispel Magic cannot be Dispelled.

name: Dissonant Whispers
description: One character of your choice that you can see within range hears a discordant melody in their mind. The target makes a Wilpower saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 2d6 + Magnitude expended x d6 of Psychic damage and must use its Action to move as far away from you as it can, using the safest route, instead of its intended Action. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only and acts as normal.

name: Divine Favour
description: Until the spell ends, your attacks with weapons deal an extra 1d4 Radiant damage on a hit.

name: Divine Smite
description: When you hit a target with a weapon, you can cast this spell. The target takes an extra 1d8 + Magnitude expended x d8 Radiant damage from the attack. The damage increases bya further 1d8 if the target is a Fiend, Fell or an Undead.

name: Dragon's Breath
description:
You touch one willing character, and choose a damage type from the table below. Until the spell ends, the target can take an Action to exhale a 15ft cone. Each character in that area makes a Reflex saving throw, taking 1d6 per Magnitude expended damage of the chosen type and suffering the condition of the chosen type on a failed save or half as much damage only on a successful one.

Damage Type | Condition
--- | ---

Acid | Pained until an Action is spent to remove the acid

Cold |Exhaustion

Fire | Burning (1d6)

Lightning | Stunned

Poison | Poisoned for 1 minute

name: Enhance Ability
description: You touch a number of characters equal to the Magnitude expended, and choose from Accuracy, Perception, Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence or Charisma. For the duration, the targets have Advantage on ability checks using the chosen ability.

name: Ensnaring Strike
description:
When you hit a target with a weapon, you can cast this spell. As you hit the target, grasping vines appear on it. A character makes a Fortitude saving throw, a Large or larger character has Advantage on this save. A character who fails the save, or an Object that weighs 300lbs or less,  has the Restrained condition until the spell ends. On a successful save or on objects heavier than 300lbs, the vines shrivel away ineffective and the spell ends.

While Restrained, the target takes Magnitude expended x d6 Piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. The target or a character within reach of it can take an Action to make a Strength check against your Magic save. On a success, the spell ends.

name: Entangle
description: Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20ft square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into Difficult Terrain. They disappear when the spell ends. Each character other than you in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or have the Immobilised condition until the spell ends. Immobilsed characters can take an Action to make an Strength check against your Magic save. On a success, they free themselves from the grasping plants and are no longer Immobilised.

name: Expeditious Dash
description: You take the Move Action as part of casting this spell. Until the spell ends, you can take the Move Action as a Bonus Action.

name: Faerie Fire
description:
Objects in a 20ft cube within range are outlined in coloured light (your choice of colour). Each character in the cube is also outlined if it fails a Reflex saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected characters shed Dim Light in a 10ft radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

name: False Life
description: You gain 2d4 + 5 x Magnitude expended Temporary Health.

name: False Magic Aura
description:
With a touch, you place an illusion on a willing character or an object that isn't being worn or carried. Characters gain the Mask effect below, and an object gains the False Aura effect below. The effect lasts for 24 hours. If you cast the spell on the same target every day for 30 days, the illusion lasts until dispelled. 

**Mask**. Choose a creature type other than the target's actual type. Spells and other magical effects treat the target as if it were a creature of the chosen type. 

**False Aura**. You change the way the target appears to spells and magical effects that detect magical auras, such as Detect Magic. You can make a nonmagical object appear magical, make a magic item appear nonmagical, or change the object's aura so that it appears to belong to a school of magic you choose.

name: Feather Fall
materials: a small feather or piece of down
description: Choose up to five Falling characters within range, which can include yourself. Their rate of descent slows to 60ft per Round until the spell ends. If a character lands before the spell ends, they take no damage from the fall, they land standing, and the spell ends for that character.

name: Floating Disk
description:
This spell creates a circular, horizontal plane of force, 3ft in diameter and 1 inch thick, that floats 3ft above the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The disk remains for the duration and can hold up to 500lbs. If more weight is placed on it, the spell ends, and everything on the disk falls to the ground.

The disk is immobile while you are within 20ft of it. If you move more than 20ft away from it, the disk follows you so that it remains within 20ft of you. It can move across uneven terrain, up or down stairs, slopes and the like, but it can't cross an elevation change of 10ft or more. For example, the disk can't move across a 10-foot-deep pit, nor could it leave such a pit if it was created at the bottom. If you move more than 100ft from the disk (typically because it can't move around an obstacle to follow you), the spell ends.

name: Fog Cloud
description: You create a 20ft per Magnitude expended radius sphere of fog centred on a point within range. The sphere is Heavily Obscured. It lasts for the duration of 1 hour or until a strong wind (such as one created by Gust of Wind) disperses it.

name: Goodberry
description: Ten berries appear in your hand and are infused with magic for the duration. A character can take a Bonus Action to eat one berry. Eating, or forcing an Incapacitated character to eat, a berry restores 1 Health, and the berry provides enough nourishment to sustain a character for one day. Uneaten berries disappear when the spell ends.

name: Grease
materials: a bit of pork rind or butter
description: Highly flammable grease covers the ground in a 15ft circle centred on a point within range and turns it into Difficult Terrain for the duration. When the grease appears, each character standing in its area must succeed on a Reflex saving throw or have the Prone condition. A character that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on that save or fall Prone. The grease automatically fails saves to suffer the Burning condition.

name: Guiding Bolt
description: You hurl a bolt of divine light toward a character within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the character. On a hit, it takes 3d6 Radiant damage, plus 1d6 per Magnitude expended, and the next attack roll made against it during the next Round has Advantage.

name: Hail of Thorns
description: When you hit a character with a ranged weapon attack, you can cast this spell. You create a rain of thorns that sprouts from your Ranged weapon's ammunition, projectile or such. The target character of the attack and each character within 5ft of them make a Reflex saving throw, taking 1d10 per Magnitude expended Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Healing Word
description: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 per Magnitude expended plus your Magic Statistic.

name: Hellish Rebuke
description: When a character within range hits you with an attack, you can cast this spell. The character that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. It makes a Reflex saving throw, taking 1d10 Fire damage plus 1d10 per Magnitude expended and suffering the Burning (1d10) condition on a failed save, or half as much damage only on a successful one.

name: Heroism
description:
Willing characters you touch are imbued with bravery. Until the spell ends, they are immune to the Frightened condition and gain Temporary Health equal to your Spell Statistic (to a minimum of 1) at the start of each Round. 

The number of characters you can touch with this spell is equal to the Magnitude expended.

name: Hex
materials: the petrified eye of a newt
description:
You place a curse on a character that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 Necrotic damage to the hexed character whenever you hit it with an attack roll. Also, choose one Statistic when you cast the spell. The target has Disadvantage on checks made with the chosen statistic. If the target drops to 0 Health before this spell ends, you can take a Bonus Action to curse a new character.

If you cast this spell with Magnitude III or greater, it does not require Concentration.

If you cast this spell with Magnitude V or greater, the duration becomes 24 hours.

name: Hideous Laughter
description: One character per Magnitude expended of your choice that you can see within range makes a Willpower saving throw. On a failed save, it has the Prone and Incapacitated conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it's capable of laughter, and it can't end the Prone condition on itself. At the end of each Round and each time it takes damage, it makes another Willpower saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

name: Hunter's Mark
description:
You magically mark one character you can see within range as your ""quarry"". Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 Force damage to your quarry whenever you hit it with an attack. You also have Advantage on any Perception or Intelligence checks you make to locate or research your quarry. If the quarry drops to 0 Health before this spell ends, you can take a Bonus Action to move the mark to a new character you can see within range.

If you cast this spell with Magnitude III or greater, it does not require Concentration.

If you cast this spell with Magnitude V or greater, the duration becomes 24 hours.

name: Ice Cannon
materials: a drop of water or a piece of ice
description: You create a exposive shell of ice that fires towards one target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the character. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Piercing damage. Hit or miss, the shell then explodes. The target and each target within 5ft of them must succeed on a Reflex saving throw or take 1d6 Cold damage plus 1d6 Cold damage per Magnitude expended.

name: Identify
description:
You touch an object throughout the spell's casting. If the object is a magic item or some other magical object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires Attunement, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell's name.

If you instead touch a character throughout the casting, you learn which ongoing spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

name: Illusory Script
materials: ink worth 10+ GP, which the spell consumes
description: You write on parchment, paper, or another suitable material and imbue it with an illusion that lasts for 10 days. To you and any characters you designate when you cast the spell, the writing appears normal, seems to be written in your hand, and conveys whatever meaning you intended when you wrote the text. To all others, the writing appears as if it were written in an unknown or magical script that is unintelligible. Alternatively, the illusion can alter the meaning, handwriting, and language of the text, though the language must be one you know. If the spell is dispelled, the original script and the illusion both disappear.A character that has Truesight can read the hidden message.

name: Inflict Wounds
description: A character you touch makes a Fortitude saving throw, taking 1d10 Necrotic damage plus 1d10 Necrotic damage per Magnitude expended on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Jump
description:
You touch willing characters. Until the spell ends, the characters can jump up to 30ft in any direction as a Bonus Actioin.

The number of characters you can touch with this spell is equal to the Magnitude expended.

name: Longstrider
description:
You touch willing characters. The characters' Speed increases by 10ft until the spell ends.

The number of characters you can touch with this spell is equal to the Magnitude expended.

name: Mage Armor
description: You touch a willing character who isn't wearing armour. Until the spell ends, the target's base Defence becomes 12. The spell ends early if the target dons armour.

name: Magic Missile
description: You create two glowing darts of magical force plus one per Magnitude expended. Each dart strikes a target of your choice that you can see within range. Each dart deals 1d4 + 1 Force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one target or several.

name: Mind Harpoon
description: You drive a spike of psionic energy into the mind of one character you can see within range. If the character has an Intelligence of N/A, the spell fails. Otherwise, the character makes a Willpower saving throw, taking d10 Psychic damage per Magnitude expended on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, you also always know the character's location until the spell ends, but only while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. While you have this knowledge, the target can't become hidden from you, and if it has the Invisible condition, it gains no benefit from that condition against you.

name: Protection from Dark Creatures
materials: a flask's worth of Holy Water worth 25+ GP, which the spell consumes
description: Until the spell ends, one willing character you touch is protected against Dark creatures (Aberrations, Demons, Fiends, Lycanthropes, Monstrosities, Fell, and Undead). The protection grants several benefits. Characters of those types have Disadvantage on attack rolls against the target character. They also can't be possessed by or gain the Charmed or Frightened conditions from them. If the target is already possessed, Charmed, or Frightened by such a character, they have Advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

name: Purify Food and Drink
description: You remove poison and rot from nonmagical food and drink in a 5ft cube, making it safe to consume.

name: Ray of Sickness
description: You shoot a sickening ray at a character within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Poison damage plus 1d8 poison damage per Magnitude expended, and the target character has the Poisoned condition until the end of the Round.

name: Resistance against Magical Creatures
materials: a pouch of crystalised mana powder worth 10+ GP, which the spell consumes
description: Until the spell ends, one willing character you touch is protected against Magical creatures (aberrations, dragons, elementals, giants, fell, fey, monstrosities and undead). The resistance grants several benefits. Characters of those types have Disadvantage on spells or magical abilities against the target character. The target also can't be possessed by or gain the Charmed or Frightened conditions from them. If the target is already possessed, Charmed, or Frightened by such a creature, the target has Advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

name: Scorching Rays
description: You hurl a number of fiery rays equal to 1 plus the Magnitude expended. You can hurl them at one target within range or at several. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 Fire damage and must make a Fortitude saving throw, suffering the Burning (1d6) condition on a failed save.

name: Searing Smite
description: When you hit a character with a weapon attack, you can cast this spell. As you hit the target, it takes an extra 1d6 Fire damage per Magnitude expended from the attack. The target suffers the Burning (1d6 ) condition.

name: Shatter
description: A loud noise erupts from a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10ft radius from the point makes a Fortitude saving throw, taking 1d8 Thunder damage plus d8 Thunder damage per Magnitude expended on a failed save and suffers the Deafened condition, or half as much damage only on a successful save. A Construct, Machine or Object has Disadvantage on the save.

name: Shield
description: When a character attempts to hit you, you can cast this spell. An imperceptible barrier of magical force springs up around you. Until the next Round, you have a +5 bonus to your Defence, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile or other magical ability that automatically hits.

name: Shield of Faith
description: Floating scripture surrounds a character of your choice within range, granting them constant half cover (a +2 bonus to their Defence and Reflex saves) for 10 minutes.

name: Silent Image
description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 15ft cube. The image appears at a spot within range and lasts for up to 10 minutes. The image is purely visual; it isn't accompanied by sound, smell, or other sensory effects.

As an action, you can cause the image to move to any spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it. A character that takes a Discern action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Investigation check against your Magic Save. If a character discerns the illusion for what it is, they can see through the image.

name: Sleep
materials: a pinch of sand or rose petals
description:
Each character of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or fall asleep, gaining the Incapacitated and Prone conditions. At the start of each Round, every character compelled to sleep can repeat the save, waking up. The spell ends on a target character if they take damage or someone within 5ft of them takes an Action to wake them.

Characters that don't sleep, such as elves, or that have Immunity to the Exhaustion condition automatically succeed on saves against this spell.

name: Speak with Animals
description: For 10 minutes, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts. Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don't pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

name: Summon Familiar
materials: burning incense worth 10+ GP, which the spell consumes
description:
You summon the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form you choose: Bat, Cat, Frog, Hawk, Lizard, Octopus, Owl, Rat, Raven, Spider, Weasel, or another Beast that has a Challenge Rating of 0. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a Celestial, Fey, Fiend or Undead (your choice) instead of a Beast. Your familiar acts independently of you, but it obeys your commands. 

**Telepathic Connection**. While your familiar is within 100ft of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as a Bonus Action, you can shut off your senses and see through the familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses it has. 

**Deliver Spells**. When you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the touch instead. Your familiar must be within 100ft of you, and it must take a Action to deliver the touch when you cast the spell. 

**Combat**. The familiar is an ally to you and your allies. It rolls its own Initiative and acts on its own turn. A familiar uses the stats and actions of its stat block as normal. 

**Destruction and Desummoning**. When the familiar drops to 0 Health, it disappears back to its home plane. When you cast this spell again, you can choose to summon the same spirit or a different one. As an Action, you can temporarily dismiss the familiar to its home plane. If you do so, you can cast this spell again without a Material cost to summon that same spirit. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever, as if it had reached 0 Health. When the familiar is destroyed or desummoned, it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying.

**Changing Form**. You can't have more than one familiar at a time, but if you cast the spell again while your familiar is present and within 100ft, you do not spend the material cost and you can change which Beast form it has.

name: Thunderous Smite
description: When you hit a target with a melee weapon attack, you can cast this spell. Your strike rings with thunder that is audible within 300ft of you, and the target takes an extra 1d6 Thunder damage plus 1d6 Thunder damage per Magnitude expended from the attack. Additionally, if the target is a character, it must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or be pushed 10ft away from you and have the Prone condition.

name: Thunderwave
description: You unleash a wave of thunderous energy with a might boom that is audible within 300ft of you. Each character within a 15ft radius of you makes a Fortitude saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d8 Thunder damage plus 1d8 Thunder damage per Magnitude expended, and is pushed 10ft away from you. On a successful save, a character takes half as much damage only. In addition, unsecured objects that are entirely within the area are pushed 10ft away from you.

name: Unseen Servant
materials: a bit of string and of wood
description:
This spell creates an Invisible Medium sized incorporeal arcane construct, a ""servant"", that acts independently and performs simple tasks to the best of its automatonic mind's ability at your command until the spell ends. If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60ft away from you, the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has the following Statistics:

Defence 8, Health 1, Speed 15ft, Accuracy -3, Strength -3, Dexterity -3 and N/A everything else. It fails all saves.

It can use the Interact, Help, Move and Use actions only.

If it drops to 0 Health, the spell ends.

name: Witch Bolt
description: A beam of crackling energy lances toward a character within range, forming a sustained arc of lightning between you and them. Make a ranged spell attack against them. On a hit, the target character takes 1d12 Lightning damage plus 1d12 Lightning damage per Magnitude expended. On subsequent Round, you can take a Bonus Action to deal 1d12 Lightning damage to the target character automatically, even if the first attack missed. The spell ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has Total Cover from you.

name: Wrathful Smite
description: When you hit a character with a melee weapon attack, you can cast this spell. The character takes an extra 1d6 Necrotic damage per Magnitude expended from the attack, and it must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or have the Frightened condition until the spell ends. At the end of each Round, the Frightened character repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

name: Alter Self
description:
You alter your physical form. Choose one of the following options. Its effects last an hour, during which you can take an Action to replace the option you chose with a different one. 
- **Aquatic Adaptation**. You sprout gills and grow webs between your fingers. You can breathe underwater and gain a Swim Speed equal to your Speed. 
- **Change Appearance**. You alter your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and other distinguishing characteristics. You can make yourself appear as a member of another species, though none of your statistics change. You can't appear as a creature of a different size, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to become quadrupedal, for instance. For the duration, you can take an Action to change your appearance in this way again.
- **Natural Weapons**. You grow claws (Slashing), fangs (Piercing), horns (Piercing), or hooves (Bludgeoning). When you use your Unarmed Strike to deal damage with that new growth, it deals 1d6 damage of the type in parentheses instead of dealing the normal damage for your Unarmed Strike, and you use your Magic Statistic for the attack and damage rolls rather than using Strength.

name: Arcane Lock
materials: gold dust worth 25+ GP, which the spell consumes
description: You touch a closed door, window, gate, container, or hatch and magically lock it for the duration. This lock can't be unlocked by any nonmagical means. You and any characters you designate when you cast the spell can open and close the object despite the lock. You can also set a password that, when spoken within 5ft of the object, unlocks it for 1 minute.

name: Arcane Vigor
description:
You tap into your life force to refresh yourself. You instantly gain the benefits of a Short Rest. If you use this spell again before taking a Long Rest, you gain a point of Exhaustion.

If you cast this spell at Magnitude V, you instantly gain the benefits of a Long Rest instead.

name: Augury
materials: specially marked sticks, bones, cards, or other divinatory tokens worth 25+ GP
description:
You receive an omen from an otherworldly entity about the results of a course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes. The DM chooses the omen from the following:
- **Weal**, for good results
- **Woe** for bad results
- **Weal and Woe** for good and bad results
- **Indifference**, neither good nor bad results.

The degree of Weal or Woe may or may not be specified (""really"", ""rather"", ""barely"" etc.) depending on the entity and the circumstances.

The spell doesn't account for circumstances, such as other spells, that might change the results. If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

name: Barkskin
description: You touch a willing character. Until the spell ends, the target's skin assumes a bark-like appearance, and the character has an Defence of 16 if it is lower than that.

name: Blur
description: Your body becomes blurred. For the duration, any character has Disadvantage on attack rolls against you. An attacker is immune to this effect if it perceives you with Blindsight or Truesight.

name: Calm Emotions
description:
Each Humanoid in a 20ft radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or be affected the following effects:

The character has Immunity to the Charmed and Frightened conditions until the spell ends. If the character was already Charmed or Frightened, those conditions are suppressed for the duration.

The character becomes Indifferent about characters of your choice that it's hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target takes damage or witnesses its allies taking damage. When the spell ends, the creature's attitude returns to normal.

name: Continual Flame
materials: ruby dust worth 50+ GP, which the spell consumes
description: A flame springs from an object that you touch. The effect casts Bright Light in a 20ft radius and Dim Light for an additional 20ft. It looks like a regular flame, but it creates no heat and consumes no fuel. The flame can be covered or hidden but not smothered or quenched.

name: Crown of Madness
description:
One Humanoid that you can see within range must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or have the Charmed condition for 1 minute. A spectral crown appears on the Charmed target's head, and it must use its Action to make a melee attack against a character other than itself that you mentally choose, or if not in reach, Move toward that character. The target can act normally on its turn if you choose no character. The target repeats the save at the end of each Round, ending the spell on itself on a success. On later Rounds, you must take an Action to maintain control of the character, or the spell ends.

If you cast this spell at Magnitude V, you do not need to use an Action to maintain control of the character.

name: Darkness
materials: bat fur and a piece of coal
description: For 10 minutes, magical Darkness spreads from a point within range and fills a 15ft radius sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15ft sphere originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness. If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

name: Darkvision
description: For 1 hour, a willing character you touch has Darkvision with a range of 150ft.

name: Detect Thoughts
description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate an effect as an Action on later Rounds. 

**Mind Sense**. You can sense the presence of characters with an Intelligence of -3 or more within 30ft of yourself, like a light in the dark. The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead. 

**Read Thoughts**. As an Action, you can target one character you can see with Mind Sense. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now and their general mood. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

**Probe** As an Action, you can try to probe deeper into the mind of a character you can see with Mind Sense. The target makes a Willpower saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the character's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an Action on its turn to make an Intelligence check against your Magic Save, ending the spell on a success.

name: Dominate Critter
description: A Tiny Beast of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Willpower saving throw, or it attempts to follow your mental commands to the best of its ability (if the target's Challenge Rating is 0, it automatically fails the save). For example, you can command the beast to deliver a message, specifying a location you have visited, a route and a recipient who matches a general description that its mind and senses can perceive. It must be within sight and range to receive mental commands, but otherwise attempts your most recent command to the best of its ability. Depending on the commands it has done, when the spell ends the Beast may see you as hostile.

name: Enlarge/Reduce
description:
For 1 minute, the spell enlarges or reduces a character or an object you can see within range (see the chosen effect below). A targeted object must be neither worn nor carried. If the target is an unwilling character, it can make a Fortitude saving throw. On a successful save, the spell has no effect.

Everything that a targeted character is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item it drops returns to normal size at once. A thrown weapon or piece of ammunition returns to normal size immediately after it hits or misses a target. Adjust your Base Defence for your new size accordingly.

**Enlarge**. The target's size increases by one category, from Medium to Large, for example. The target also has Advantage on Strength checks and Fortitude saving throws. The target's attacks with its enlarged weapons or Unarmed Strikes deal an extra 1d4 damage on a hit. 

**Reduce**. The target's size decreases by one category, from Medium to Small, for example. The target also has Disadvantage on Strength checks and Fortitude saving throws. The target's attacks with its reduced weapons or Unarmed Strikes deal 1d4 less damage on a hit (this can't reduce the damage below 1).

name: Enthrall
description: You weave a distracting string of words, causing characters of your choice that you can see within range to make a Willpower saving throw. Any character you or your allies are fighting automatically succeed on this save. On a failed save, a target has a -10 penalty to Perception checks and their Passive Perception is reduced by 10 to a minimum of 0.

name: Find Steed
description:
You summon an Otherworldly Steed (see Stat Blocks), that appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. The Health of the steed is instead  10 per Magnitude expended and it's Bonus is instead equal to the Magnitude expended up to a maximum of 5. If you already have a steed from this spell, the steed is replaced by the new one.

The steed resembles a Large, rideable animal of your choice, such as a horse, a camel, a dire wolf, or an elk. Whenever you cast the spell, choose the steed's creature type: Celestial, Demon,  Fiend or Juror. This determines certain traits in the stat block. 

**Combat**. The steed is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, it functions as a Controlled Mount while you ride it. If you have the Incapacitated condition, the steed acts independently, focusing on protecting you. 

**Disappearance of the Steed**. The steed disappears if it drops to 0 Health or if you die. When it disappears, it leaves behind anything it was wearing or carrying. If you cast this spell again, you decide whether you summon the steed that disappeared or a different one.

name: Find Traps
description: You sense any trap within range that is within line of sight. A trap, for the purpose of this spell, includes any object or mechanism that was created to cause damage or other danger. Thus, the spell would sense the Alarm or Glyph of Warding spell or a mechanical pit trap, but it wouldn't reveal a natural weakness in the floor, an unstable ceiling, or a hidden sinkhole. This spell reveals that a trap is present but not its location. You do learn the general nature of the danger posed by a trap you sense.

name: Flame Blade
description:
You evoke a fiery blade in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a scimitar, and it lasts for 10 minutes. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke it for 10 minutes after the initial casting again for free as a Bonus Action. The flaming blade sheds Bright Light in a 10ft radius and Dim Light for an additional 10ft.

As an Action, you can make a melee spell attack with the fiery blade. On a hit, the target takes Fire damage equal to 2d6 plus 1d6 per Magnitude expended plus your Magic Statistic, and the target must make a Fortitude save where they suffer the Burning (1d6) condition on a failed save.

name: Flaming Sphere
description:
You create a 5ft sphere of fire in an unoccupied space hovering 1 to 5ft above a point on the ground within range. It lasts for 1 minute. Any charater that ends its turn within the sphere makes a Fortitude saving throw, suffering 1d6 Fire damage per Magnitude expended and the Burning (1d6 per Magnitude expended) condition on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the sphere up to 30ft, hovering it above the ground at an altitude of your choice between 1 and 5 ft. If you move the sphere into a charcter's space, they make the save against the sphere, and the sphere stops moving for the Round. When you move the sphere, you can direct it over barriers up to 5ft tall and jump it across pits up to 10ft wide. 

The sphere sheds Bright Light in a 20ft radius and Dim Light for an additional 20ft.

name: Gentle Repose
materials: 2 Copper Pieces, which the spell consumes
description: You touch a corpse or other remains. For the duration, the target is protected from decay and can't become Undead. The spell also effectively extends the time limit on raising the target from the dead, since days spent under the influence of this spell don't count against the time limit of spells such as Raise Dead.

name: Gust of Wind
description:
A Line of strong wind 60ft long, 10ft tall and 10ft wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the duration. Each character in the Line must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or be pushed 15ft away from you in a direction following the Line. A character that Moves in or through the Line must make the same save, ending their movement accordingly. Successful Movement in the Line treats it as Difficult Terrain.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes non-magical flames fully contained in the area. As a Bonus Action on later Rounds, you can change the direction in which the Line blasts from you. You cannot Move while maintaining the spell. If you are forcefully moved, the spell ends.

name: Heat Metal
materials: a piece of iron and a flame
description:
Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of Heavy or Medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any character in physical contact with the object takes 1d8 Fire damage per Magnitude expended when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can take a Bonus Action on each of your later turns to deal this damage again if the object is within range.

If a character is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, they must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn't drop the object, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the next Round.

name: Hold Person
description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or have the Incapacitated condition for the duration. At the end of each Round, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

For each Magnitude expended above II, you can target another Humanoid with this spell.

name: Invisibility
description:
A character you touch has the Invisible condition until the spell ends. The spell ends if they make an attack roll, deal damage, or cast a spell.

For each Magnitude expended above II, you can target another Humanoid with this spell.

name: Knock
description: Choose an object that you can see within range. The object can be a door, a box, a chest, a set of manacles, a padlock, or another object that contains a mundane or magical means that prevents access. A target that is held shut by a mundane lock or that is stuck or barred becomes unlocked, unstuck, or unbarred. If the object has multiple locks, only one of them is unlocked. If the target is held shut by Arcane Lock, that spell is suppressed for 10 minutes, during which time the target can be opened and closed. When you cast the spell, a loud knock, audible up to 300ft away, emanates from the target.

name: Lesser Restoration
description: You touch a character and end one condition on it: Blinded / Deafened, Incapacitated, Immobilised, Pained, Poisoned or Sluggish.

name: Levitate
description:
One character or loose object of your choice that you can see within range rises vertically up to 20ft and remains suspended there for the duration. The spell can levitate an object that weighs up to 500 pounds. An unwilling character that succeeds on a Fortitude saving throw is unaffected.

The target character can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing. You can change the target's altitude by up to 20ft in either direction in later Rounds as an Action, but must remain within the spell's range. When the spell ends, the target floats gently to the ground if it is still aloft as if affected by Feather Fall.

name: Locate Animals or Plants
description: Describe or name a specific kind of Beast or Plant (creature or object) (including fungi). You learn the direction and rough distance to the closest Beast or Plant of that kind within 5 miles, if any are present.

name: Locate Object
description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object's location if that object is within 1,000ft of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close within 30ftat least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon. This spell can't locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

name: Locate Person
materials: a compass and a drop of the targets blood, which the spell consumes
description:
You learn the direction and rough distance to the Humanoid to whom the drop of blood belongs if they are within the distance described below.

Magnitude Expended | Distance
--- | ---

II | 1 Mile

III | 8 Miles

IV | 100 Miles

V | The Plane

name: Magic Mouth
materials: jade dust worth 10+ GP, which the spell consumes
description:
You implant a message within an object in range, a message that is uttered when a trigger condition is met. Choose an object that you can see and that isn't being worn or carried by another character. Then speak the message, which must be 25 words or fewer, though it can be delivered over as long as 10 minutes. Finally, determine the circumstance that will trigger the spell to deliver your message.

When that trigger occurs, a magical mouth appears on the object and recites the message in your voice and at the same volume you spoke. If the object you chose has a mouth or something that looks like a mouth (for example, the mouth of a statue), the magical mouth appears there, so the words appear to come from the object's mouth. When you cast this spell, you can have the spell end after it delivers its message, or it can remain and repeat its message whenever the trigger occurs.

The trigger can be as general or as detailed as you like, though it must be based on visual or audible conditions that occur within 30ft of the object. For example, you could instruct the mouth to speak when any creature moves within 30ft of the object or when a silver bell rings within 30ft of it.

name: Magic Weapon
description:
You touch a nonmagical weapon. Until the spell ends, that weapon becomes a magic weapon with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls. The spell ends early if you cast it again.

If you cast this spell at Magnitude III to V, the bonus is +2. If you cast this spell at Magnitude VI or above, the bonus is +3.

name: Mind Shield
description: You touch a character and end the Sluggish condition, if the target character suffers due to Psychic damage. For 1 hour, the character has Advantage on saving throws caused by Psychic effects, and they have Resistance to Psychic damage.

name: Mirror Image
description: Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with you and mimic your actions, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real. Each time a character hits you with an attack roll during the spell's duration, roll a d6 for each of your remaining duplicates. If any of the d6s rolls a 3 or higher, one of the duplicates is hit instead of you, and the duplicate is destroyed. The duplicates otherwise ignore all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed. A character is unaffected by this spell if it has the Blinded condition, Blindsight, or Truesight.

name: Misty Step
description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30ft to an unoccupied space you can see.

name: Moonbeam
description:
A silvery beam of pale light shines down in a 5ft radius, 40ft high cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, Dim Light fills the cylinder, and you can take an Action on later Rounds to move the cylinder up to 60ft.

When the cylinder appears or is moved over a character that was not currently in the cylinder, each character in it makes a Fortitude saving throw. On a failed save, a character takes d10 Radiant damage per Magnitude expended. On a successful save, a character takes half as much damage only. A character is affected only once per Round.

If the character is shape-shifted (as a result of the Polymorph spell, for example) and fails the save, it reverts to its true form and can't shape-shift until it leaves the cylinder. If the character is a Lycanthrope, it immediately transforms into its monsterous form regardless of the save.

name: Pass without Trace
description: You radiate a concealing aura in a 30ft radius. Each character you choose is considered to have Expertise in Stealth for 1 hour, makes Stealth checks at Advantage, and leaves no tracks.

name: Phantasmal Force
description:
You attempt to craft an illusion in the mind of a character you can see within range. The target makes an Willpower saving throw. On a failed save, you create a phantasmal object, creature, or other phenomenon that is no larger than a 10ft cube and that is perceivable only to the target for the duration. The phantasm includes sound, temperature, and other stimuli. 

The target can take a Discern Action to examine the phantasm with an Intelligence check against your Magic Save. If the check succeeds, the target realizes that the phantasm is an illusion, and the spell ends.

While affected by the spell, the target treats the phantasm as if it were real and rationalizes any illogical outcomes from interacting with it. For example, if the target steps through a phantasmal bridge and survives the fall, it believes the bridge exists and something else caused it to fall. An affected target can even take damage from the illusion if the phantasm represents a dangerous creature or hazard. On each of your turns, such a phantasm can deal d8 Psychic damage per Magnitude expended to the target if it is in the phantasm's area or within 5ft of the phantasm. The target perceives the damage as a type appropriate to the illusion.

name: Prayer of Healing
description: Up to five characters of your choice who remain within range for the spell's entire casting of 10 minutes gain the benefits of a Short Rest and also regain d8 Health per Magnitude expended. A character can't be affected by this spell again until that character finishes a Long Rest.

name: Protection from Energy
description:
You touch a character and choose one of the following effects:

**Fire Protection**. You end the Burning condition, if the target character suffers it. For 1 hour, the character has Advantage on saving throws  to avoid or end the Burning condition, and they have Resistance to Fire damage.

**Cold Protection**. If the target character has Exhaustion from Cold damage, and has not benefited from this spell since the last Long Rest, you remove one point of Exhaustion from them.  For 1 hour, the character has Advantage on saving throws to resist Exhaustion from Cold damage, and they have Resistance to Cold damage.

**Lightning Protection**. For 1 hour, the character has Advantage on saving throws  to avoid being Stunned by Lightning damage, and they have Resistance to Lightning damage.

name: Protection from Organic Harm
description:
You touch a character and choose one of the following effects:

**Acid Protection**. You end the Pained condition, if the target character suffers due to Acid damage. For 1 hour, the character has Advantage on saving throws caused by Acid, and they have Resistance to Acid damage.

**Poison Protection**. You end the Poisoned condition, if the target character suffers it. For 1 hour, the character has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Poisoned condition, and they have Resistance to Poison damage.

name: Protection from the Mystical
description:
You touch a character and choose one of the following effects:

**Protection from Good**. You end the Charmed or Frightened conditions, if the target character suffers any of them due to Radiant damage. For 1 hour, the character has Advantage on saving throws caused by celestial effects, and they have Resistance to Radiant damage.

**Protection from Evil**. You end the Incapacitated condition, if the target character suffers it due to Necrotic damage. For 1 hour, the character has Advantage on saving throws caused by Necrotic damage, and they have Resistance to Necrotic damage.

name: Ray of Enfeeblement
description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a character within range. The target must make a Fortitude saving throw. 

On a successful save, the character has Disadvantage on any attack rolls it makes this Round. Additionally, on a failed save, the character is Immobilised by the necrotic energy, becoming corpse-like and aged. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

name: Rope Trick
description:
You touch a rope. One end of it hovers upward until the rope hangs perpendicular to the ground or the rope reaches a ceiling. At the rope's upper end, an Invisible 3ft by 5ft portal opens to an extradimensional space that lasts until the spell ends. That space can be reached by climbing the rope, which can be pulled into or dropped out of it.

The space can hold up to eight Medium or smaller characters. Attacks, spells, and other effects can't pass into or out of the space, but characters inside it can see through the portal. Anything inside the space drops out when the spell ends.

name: See Invisibility
