description: For the duration, you see characters and objects that have the Invisible condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Characters and objects there appear ghostly.

name: Shining Smite
description: You can cast this spell when you hit a character. The character hit by the strike takes an extra d6 Radiant damage per Magnitude expended from the attack. Until the spell ends, the target sheds Bright Light in a 5ft radius, attack rolls against it have Advantage, and it can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

name: Silence
description: For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20ft radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any target entirely inside the sphere has Immunity to Thunder damage, and charcters have the Deafened condition. Casting a spell that includes a Verbal component is impossible there.

name: Spider Climb
materials: a drop of bitumen and a spider
description:
Until the spell ends, a character you touch gains the ability to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and along ceilings, as their feet stubbornly stick to any surface while leaving their hands free. The target gains the equivalent of a Climb Speed equal to its Speed.

For each Magnitude expended above II, you can target another character with this spell.

name: Spike Growth
description:
The ground in a 20ft radius sphere centered on a point within range sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes Difficult Terrain for 10 minutes. When a character moves into or within the area, it takes 2d4 Piercing damage for every 5ft it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any character that can't see the area when the spell is cast must take a Discern Action to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

name: Spiritual Weapon
description:
You create a floating, incorporeal magical construct of spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make a number of melee spell attacks against one character within 5ft of it, listed below. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Force damage plus your Magic Statistic. As a Bonus Action on later Rounds, you can move the weapon up to the distance listed below and repeat the attacks against a character within 5ft of it.

The weapon cannot be targeted as it is a magical effect, not a character, but can be dispelled.

Magnitude | No. of Attacks | Move
--- | --- | ---

II | 1 | 20ft

III | 2 | 25ft

IV | 3 | 30ft

V+ | 4 | 35ft

name: Suggestion
description: You suggest a course of activity described in no more than 25 words to one character you can see within range that can hear and understand you. If the character has N/A intelligence or does not understand the language you use, the spell fails. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or it allies. For example, you could say, "You want to fetch the key to the cult's treasure vault, and give the key to me." Or you could say, "You want to stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, never to return." The character must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or think the suggestion is its own idea and its top priority, rationalising as necessary. The character pursues the suggestion to the best of their ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for them upon completing it.

name: Summon Beast
materials: a feather, tuft of fur, and fish tail inside a gilded acorn worth 200+ GP
description:
You call forth a bestial spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range, and uses the Bestial Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose a type: Air, Land, or Water. which determines certain details in its stat block. The beast resembles an appropriate animal of your choice. They disappear when they drops to 0 Health or when the spell ends.

The character is an ally to you and your allies. It obeys your verbal commands (no Action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge Action to avoid danger or Move Action to follow you.

If you cast this spell at Magnitude IV or V, the Bestial Spirit has Multiattack II and plus 10 Health.

If you cast this spell at Magnitude VI or above, the Bestial Spirit has Multiattack III and plus 20 Health.

name: Warding Bond
materials: a pair of platinum rings worth 50+ GP each, which you and the target must wear for the duration
description:
You touch another character that is willing and create a mystic connection between you and the target until the spell ends. While the target is within 60ft of you, it gains a +1 bonus to Defence and saving throws, and it has Resistance to all damage. Also, each time it takes damage, you take the same amount of damage.

The spell ends if you drop to 0 Health or if you and the character become separated by more than 60ft. It also ends if the spell is cast again on either of the connected creatures.

name: Web
description:
You conjure a mass of sticky webbing at a point within range. The webs must be anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) where they fill a 20ft cube, or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, where have a depth of 5ft, otherwise the spell fails. The webs are Difficult Terrain, and the area within them is Lightly Obscured.

The first time a character enters the webs on a Round or starts the Round there, it must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw against your Spell Save or have the Restrained condition while in the webs or until it breaks free.

The webs are flammable. Any 5ft cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 Round, dealing 2d4 Fire damage to any character caught in the fire.

name: Zone of Truth
description: You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15ft radius sphere centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, a character that enters the spell's area for the first time in a Round or starts the Round there makes a Willpower saving throw. On a failed save, a character can't speak a deliberate lie while in the affect. You know whether a character succeeds or fails on this save. An affected character is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a character can be evasive yet must be truthful.

name: Animate Dead
materials: a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust
description:
When you cast this spell, you choose to Raise Dead, or Bind Dead.

**Raise Dead** Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small Humanoid within range. You animate it, and the target becomes an Undead creature bound to your control for 24 hours: a Skeleton if you chose bones or a Zombie if you chose a corpse.

**Bind Dead** Choose up to four Undead you have previously animated with this spell. You bind them to your control for a further 24 hours, refreshing any duration if they are still bound, or binding them anew if they were unbound.

On each of your turns, you can take a Bonus Action to mentally command any Undead you have bound that are within 60ft of you (if you control multiple Undead, you can command any of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the Undead will take on its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the Undead take the Move Action to be in reach of the nearest hostile or neutral life, and the Dodge Action if unable to Move. Once given an order, the Undead continues to follow it until its task is complete.

name: Aura of Vitality
description: An aura radiates from you in a 30ft radius for 1 minute. When you create the aura and at the start of each Round while it persists, you can restore 2d6 Health to one character in it, not including yourself.

name: Beacon of Hope
description: Choose any number of characters within range. For 1 minute, each target has Advantage on Willpower saving throws and Death Saving Throws and regains the maximum number of Health possible from any healing.

name: Bestow Curse
description:
You touch a character, which must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or become cursed for the duration listed below. Until the curse ends, the target suffers one of the following effects of your choice:
- **Weakness** Choose one ability. The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability.
- **Unlucky** The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
- **Quaker** In combat, the target must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw at the start of each Round or be forced to take the Dodge Action.

Additionally, if you deal damage to the target with an attack roll or a spell, the target takes an extra 1d8 Necrotic damage.

| Magnitude | Duration | Concentration |

| --- | --- | --- |

| III | 1 minute | yes |

| IV | 10 minutes | yes |

| V | 8 hours | no |

| VI | Until dispelled | no |

name: Blinding Smite
description: You can cast this spell when you hit a character. The character hit by the strike takes an extra d8 Radiant damage per Magnitude expended from the attack, and the target has the Blinded condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the Blinded character makes a Fortitude saving throw, ending the spell on itself on a success.

name: Blink
description:
You seemingly begin to chaoticaly blink in and out of existence. Roll 1d6 at the start of each Round for 1 minute. On a roll of 4-6, you are Vanished, otherwise you are Present.

**Vanished**. You have disappeared from your current plane of existence and appeared in the Ethereal Plane. While on the Ethereal Plane, you can perceive the plane you left, which is cast in shades of gray, but you can't see anything there more than 60ft away. Notably objects and creatures that bar your path in the Material most likely will not have equivilents in the Ethereal. You can affect and be affected only by other creatures on the Ethereal Plane, and creatures on the other plane can't perceive you unless they have a special ability that lets them perceive things on the Ethereal Plane.

**Present**. You are present on the other plane as normal, and act as normal.

You cannot cast this spell from the Ethereal Plane. You return to the other plane at the start of the next round and when the spell ends if you are on the Ethereal Plane. You return in the nearest unoccupied space.

name: Call Lightning
description:
A storm cloud appears at a point within range that you can see above yourself until the spell ends. It takes the rough shape of a Cylinder that is 10ft tall with a 60ft radius.

When you cast the spell, choose a point you can see under the cloud. A lightning bolt shoots from the cloud to that point. Each creature within 5ft of that point makes a Reflex saving throw, taking d10 Lightning damage per Magnitude expended on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Until the spell ends, you can take an Action to call down lightning in that way again, targeting the same point or a different one. If you're outdoors in a storm when you cast this spell, the spell gives you control over that storm instead of creating a new one. Under such conditions, the spell's damage increases by 1d10.

name: Clairvoyance
materials: a glass or quartz lense worth at least 100 GP
description:
You create an incorporeal immobile Invisible sensor within the 1 mile range in a location you have visited or seen before, or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you (such as behind a door, around a corner, or in a grove of trees). The sensor can freely rotate in all directions if you will it.

The sensor can see and hear normally with a Perception of 2. As a Bonus Action, you can shut off your senses and see through the sensor's for the duration of a Turn.

A character that sees the sensor (such as a creature benefiting from See Invisibility or Truesight) sees a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

name: Conjure Nature Spirits
description:
You conjure 4 Nature Spirits that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range, as a pack of spectral animal spirits. When you do so, you choose if all the spirits are either Fell or Fey type, and if they are Arboreal, Terrestrial, Amphibian or Aerial (see the stat block).

They last for the 10 minute duration, and you also choose each spirits' animal form, such as a wolf, a serpent, a swordfish or a bird, appropraite to its Medium size and chosen type.

You decide on the actions of the spirits during a Round, or the GM does should you be out of contact, unconscious etc. The spirits, in their own way, try to aid you as best they see fit.

As a Bonus Action, you can detonate the energies of a spirit of your choice within sight. It is unconjured, and deal 1d10 necrotic (if Fell) or radiant (if Fey) damage per Magnitude expended.

name: Conjure Barrage
materials: a Melee or Ranged weapon worth at least 1 CP
description: You brandish the weapon used to cast the spell and conjure similar spectral weapons (or ammunition appropriate to the weapon) that launch forward and then disappear. Each creature of your choice that you can see in a 60-foot Cone makes a Reflex saving throw, taking 2d8 Force damage plus 1d8 per Magnitude expended on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Counterspell
description: You can cast this spell when you see another character cast a spell in range. You attempt to interrupt the character in the process of casting a spell. They make a Fortitude saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the Action or Bonus Action used to cast it is wasted, but any Mana or components aren't expended.

name: Create Food and Water
description: You create 15 rations of food and of fresh water on the ground or in containers within range, both useful in fending off the hazards of malnutrition and dehydration. The food is bland but nourishing cotton-lie fluff, and the water is clean. The food and water vanish after 24 hours if uneaten.

name: Crusader's Mantle
description: You radiate a magical aura in a 30ft radius. While in the aura, you and your allies each deal an extra 1d4 Radiant damage for Weapon Attacks and Unarmed Strikes.

name: Daylight
description:
For the 1 hour duration, sunlight spreads from a point within range. Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or cloak, blocks the sunlight.

The sunlight is Bright Light for 60ft and Dim Light for an additional 60ft, shedding in a sphere.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Darkness created by a spell of Magnitude III or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

name: Elemental Weapon
description:
A nonmagical weapon you touch becomes a magic weapon for the 1 hour duration. 

Choose one Energy damage type: Cold, Fire or Lightning. The weapon has a bonus to attack rolls and deals extra damage of the chosen type when it hits. See the table below for values per Magnitude:

| Magnitude | Extra Damage | Attack roll Bonus |

| --- | --- | --- |

| III | 1d4 | +1 |

| IV | 1d6 | +1 |

| V | 2d4 | +2 |

| VI | 2d6 | +2 |

| VII | 3d6 | +3 |

name: Fear
description:
Each character in a 10ft per Magnitude expended cone must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and have the Frightened condition for the duration.

If the character ends the Round in a space where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the character makes a Willpower saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on them.

name: Feign Death
description:
You touch a willing character and put it into a cataleptic state that is indistinguishable from death.

For the hour per Magnitude expended duration, the target appears dead to outward inspection and to spells used to determine the target's status. The target has the Blinded and Incapacitated conditions. The target has Advantage on saves against being Poisoned, and resistance to Poison damage.

If cast at Magnitude III+, the target also has Resistance to all damage except Psychic and Force damage, and it has Immunity to the Poisoned condition, and Poison damage.

name: Fireball
materials: a ball of bat guano and sulfur
description: A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each character in a 15 ft radius sphere centered on that point makes a Reflex saving throw, taking 2d10 Fire damage plus 1d10 Fire damage per Magnitude expended on a failed save and suffers the Burning (1d10) condition, or half as much damage only on a successful one. Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried automatically fail the save.

name: Fly
description:
You touch a willing character. For the 10 minute duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60ft and can hover. If the target is still aloft when the spell ends or Concentration is lost, the target is Falling from its height.

At Magnitude V, the duration is 1 hour. At Magnitude VI, the duration is indefinite and the spell cannot be dispelled. It will end when you choose, you loose concentration, or you sleep.

name: Gaseous Form
description:
A willing character you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, transforms into a medium sized opaque cloud for the 1 hour duration. The spell ends on the target if it drops to 0 Health or if it takes an Action to end the spell on itself.

For each Magnitude expended above III, you can target one more will character to touch.

The Gaseous Form's only movement is a Fly Speed of 10ft, and it can hover. It can enter and occupy the space of another character. It can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid. The target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can't attack or cast spells.

The Gaseous Form has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the Prone condition; and it has Advantage on Fortitude saving throws.

name: Glyph of Warding
materials: a spyglass or other lense  worth 1000+ GP
description:
You inscribe a warding glyph that unleashes a magical effect when triggered. You inscribe it on a surface (such as a table, a section of wall or the bottom of a box). The glyph can covers an area of 1ft to 10ft in diameter. If the surface is moved more than 10ft from where you cast this spell, the glyph fades without being triggered. The glyph is barely perceptible and requires a successful Perception check to notice.

When you inscribe the glyph, you set its trigger and choose a spell glyph, as explained below. 

**Trigger** - You decide what triggers the glyph when you cast the spell. Common triggers include touching or stepping on the glyph, removing another object or lid covering it, approaching within a certain distance of it, or simply seeing the glyph. You can refine the trigger so that only certain identifiable characters activate it, such as only dragonborn, only bearers of a certain symbol, or only Fiends. You can also choose characters that don't trigger the glyph, such as those who say a certain password. Once a glyph is triggered, this spell ends.

 

**Spell Glyph** - You can store a prepared spell of the Magnitude expended or lower in the glyph by casting it as part of creating the glyph. The spell must target a single character or an area. The spell being stored has no immediate effect when cast in this way. When the glyph is triggered, the stored spell takes effect. If the spell has a target, it targets the character that triggered the glyph. If the spell affects an area, the area is centered on that character. If the spell summons Hostile characters or creates harmful objects or traps, they appear as close as possible to the intruder and attack it. If the spell requires Concentration, it lasts until the end of its full duration.

name: Haste
description:
Choose a willing character that you can see within 30ft, they gain a series of benefits for the 1 minute duration while you concentrate:

 - If they take the Move action, they move twice the distance. 
- They gain their Bonus to Reflexes, and have Advantage on Reflex Saving Throws
- They gain an additional Action each Round.

When the spell ends, the target is Incapacitated for 1 minute, as a wave of lethargy washes over them.

name: Hunger of the Dark Star
description:
A 20ft radius sphere of Darkness appears, centred on a point of open terrain within the 150ft range and lasting for the 1 minute duration. The area is filled with strange whispers, slurping noises and the terrible forces of the primordial chaos. No light, magical or otherwise, can illuminate the area, and characters fully within it have the Blinded condition. 

When the spell is cast, a number of tentacles burst from the darkness equal to the Magnitude expended, each targetting a character within 10ft. They must make a Reflex save or be dragged to the centre of the area to the nearest open space.

At the end of a Round, any character in the area takes 1d6 Cold damage, 1d6 Force damage, and 1d6 Acid damage.

name: Hypnotic Pattern
description:
You create a twisting pattern of colors in a 30-foot Cube within 120ft range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each character with an Intelligence Stat in the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or have the Incapacitated condition.

The spell ends for an affected character if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an Action when within 5ft to shake them out of their stupor.

name: Hemisphere of Force
description:
A 10ft hollow hemi-sphere of pure force springs into existence around you and remains stationary for the 8 hour duration. The base of the hemisphere conforms with the ground. If any characters or objects would intersect the dome, the spell fails to cast.

Characters and objects of your choice can move through it freely, and everything else is barred from passing through it. Weapons bounce off, and spells of Magnitude III or lower can't be cast through it, and the effects of such spells can't extend into it.

The atmosphere inside the dome is comfortable and dry, regardless of the weather outside, and the external surface of the dome looks like any colour or texture you choose, although it is smooth and cool to the touch. Internally the dome is transparent like glass. The spell ends early if you leave the dome or if you cast it again.

name: Lightning Arrow
description:
You can cast this spell when you make a Ranged Weapon Attack. The weapon or ammunition transforms into a lightning bolt. Instead of taking any damage or other effects from the attack, the target takes 1d8 Lightning damage per Magnitude expended on a hit or half as much damage on a miss. 

If the first target fails the save, the nearest target within 10ft of the first that is not in full or three-quarter cover then makes a Reflex Save, taking 1d6 Lightning damage per Magnitude Expended on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Repeat on failed saves.

The weapon or ammunition then returns to its normal form.

name: Lightning Bolt
materials: a bit of fur and a crystal rod
description: A stroke of lightning forming a 100ft long, 5ft wide line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each character in the line makes a Reflex Save, taking 2d6 Lightning damage per Magnitude Expended on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Magic Circle
materials: salt and powdered silver worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes
description:
You create a 10ft radius circle of magical glowing runes on the ground. 

Choose one or more of the following Creature Types: Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, or Undead. The circle affects characters of the chosen Creature Type in the following ways:
- They can't willingly enter the circle by nonmagical means. If a character tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to do so, they must first succeed on a Willpower Save.
- They have Disadvantage on attack rolls against targets within the circle.
- Characters within the Cylinder can't be possessed by or gain the Charmed or Frightened condition from the target characters.

When you cast this spell, you can cause its magic to operate in the reverse direction. The magic extends up to 100ft into open air, or up to any solid surface such as a roof or cave wall.

name: Major Image
description:
You create the image of an object, a character, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20ft cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can't deal damage or cause conditions, and is incorporeal.

If you are within the 120ft range of the illusion, you can take an Action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance and other sense effects so that it appears natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a young dragon and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be stalking prey, the slither of its scales and the smell of the smoke drifting up from its nostrils. 

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it.

name: Mass Healing Word
description: Up to six characters of your choice that you can see within the 60ft range regain Health equal to 2d4 per Magnitude Expended plus your Magic Stat.

name: Meld into Stone
description:
You step into a stone object or surface large enough to fully contain your body, merging yourself and your equipment with the stone for the duration. You must touch the stone to do so. Nothing of your presence remains visible or otherwise detectable by nonmagical senses.

While merged with the stone, you can't see what occurs outside it, and any Perception checks you make to hear sounds outside it are made with Disadvantage. You remain aware of the passage of time and can cast spells on yourself while merged in the stone. You can use 5ft of movement to leave the stone where you entered it, which ends the spell. You otherwise can't move.

Minor physical damage to the stone doesn't harm you, but its partial destruction or a change in its shape (to the extent that you no longer fit within it) expels you and deals 6d6 Force damage to you. The stone's complete destruction (or transmutation into a different substance) expels you and deals 50 Force damage to you. If expelled, you move into an unoccupied space closest to where you first entered and have the Prone condition.

name: Nondetection
materials: a pinch of diamond dust worth 25+ GP, which the spell consumes
description: For the 8 hour duration, you hide a target that you touch from Divination spells. The target can be a willing character, or it can be a place or an object no larger than 10ft in any dimension. The target can't be targeted by any Divination spell or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

name: Phantom Steed
description:
A Large, quasi-real, horselike creature appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature's appearance

For the duration, you or a character you choose can ride the steed. The steed uses the Riding Horse stat block, except it has a Speed of 100ft and can travel 13 miles in an hour. When the spell ends, the steed gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends early if the steed takes any damage.

name: Plant Growth
description:
This spell channels vitality into plants. The casting time you use determines the spell effect:

**Overgrowth** - When you cast this spell as an Action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100ft radius sphere centered on that point become thick and overgrown: becoming Difficult Terrain and constant Half Cover. You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

**Controller Growth** - When you cast this spell as a 1 minute Ritual, choose a plant in range. It rapidly grows up to 100ft in length in a manner of your choice, pushing through walls and upturning earth. A tree could span a narrow gorge or a lily pad grow to cover a dangerous section of swamp. This plant cannot be effected by Plant Growth again for 1 year.

**Enrichment** - When you cast this spell as a 1 hour Ritual, all plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range become enriched for 365 days. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested. They can benefit from only one Plant Growth per year.

name: Protection from Energy
description: For the duration, the willing character you touch has Resistance to one damage type of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder.

name: Remove Curse
description: At your touch, all curses affecting one character or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

name: Revivify
materials: a diamond worth 300+ GP, which the spell consumes
description:
You touch a character that has died within the last minute. If their soul is weakly tethered to life, such as through old age or pacts-come-due, the GM may ask for a Save or fail the spell entirely.

If the spell is successful, they revive with 1 Health, though the effects of Wounds (except Death), last.

name: Sending
description:
You send a short message of 25 words or fewer to a character you are Familiar with. The target can choose to receive or reject the Sending. If they accept it, they hear the message in their mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner with 25 words immediately. If they reject it, you learn that you were blocked, and the spell fails.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence.

name: Sleet Storm
description:
Until the spell ends, sleet falls in a 40ft tall, 20ft radius cylinder centered on a point you choose within the 150ft range. The area is Heavily Obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused and any Burning conditions end. Ground in the cylinder is Difficult Terrain. 

When a character starts a Round in the cylinder, it must succeed on a Reflex Save or have the Prone condition and lose Concentration.

name: Slow
description:
You alter time around up to six characters of your choice that you can see in the 60ft range. Each target character must succeed on a Willpower saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's Speed is halved, they take a -2 penalty to Defence and Reflex Saves, and they are Sluggish. 

An affected target repeats the save at the end of the Round, ending the spell on itself on a success.

name: Speak with Dead
description:
You grant the semblance of life to a humanoid corpse of your choice within 10ft, allowing it to answer questions you pose. This spell fails if the deceased was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.

name: Speak with Plants
description:
You imbue plants in a 30ft radius centred on you at the moment of casting, with limited sentience and animation, giving them the ability to communicate with you and follow your simple commands. The spell doesn't enable plants to uproot themselves and move about, but they can move their branches, tendrils, and stalks for you, opening or closing paths and so on. 

You can question plants about events in the spell's area within the past day, gaining information about creatures that have passed, weather, and other circumstances.

If a Plant type Character is in the area, you can communicate with it as if you shared a common language.

name: Spirit Guardians
description:
Protective spirits flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the 10 minute duration or until the spell ends. Their form reflects the nature of your faith. Choose if the the spirits deal Radiant or Necrotic damage when you cast the spell.

Any hostile Character's Speed is halved in the area.

Whenever a Character starts a Round in the area, they must make a Fortitude saving throw. On a failed save, the character takes 1d8 Radiant / Necrotic damage per Magnitude expended and their Speed is halved. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

name: Poison Cloud
description:
You create a 15ft radius sphere of thick, toxic gas centered on a point within range. The cloud is Heavily Obscured. The cloud lingers in the air for the duration or until a strong wind disperses it.

Each Character that starts its turn in the area must succeed on a Fortitude Save or have the Poisoned and Slugish Conditions until the end of the Round.

name: Raise Undead
materials: a Medium corpse which the spell consumes, and a black opal worth 300gp
description:
You turn the corpse into an undead servant, consuming it in the process. You call forth an Undead Servant, using the Undead Servant stat block. When you cast the spell, choose the creature's form based on the state of the corpse: Ghost for the interned or ashes, Zombie for whole corpses, or Skeleton for piles of bones. 

The creature collapses when it drops to 0 Health or when the spell ends. The creature is an ally to you and your allies. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action or Moves to avoid danger.

name: Tongues
description:
The character you touch gains the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees, and when they speak or sign, any Character that can comprehend language can understand it if they hear the speech or see the signing.

When this spell is cast at Magnitude III or higher, it can be maintained without Concentration.

name: Fell Touch
description: You wreathe your hand in shadow so that its very touch can siphon life force from others to heal your wounds. While concentrating on this spell, you can make make melee spell attack Actions against a character within reach. On a hit, they take 1d6 Necrotic damage per Magnitude initially expended, and you regain Health equal to half the amount of Necrotic damage dealt.

name: Water Breathing
description: This spell grants up to three willing characters per Magnitude expended of your choice within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends.

name: Water Walk
description:
You treat any liquid surfaces as solid stable ground (including semi-liquids like mud and snow). Up to three willing characters per Magnitude Expended of your choice within the 30ft range gain this ability for the 1 hour duration.

Any affected target can take a Bonus Action to pass from the liquid's surface into the liquid itself and vice versa, but if the target is Falling, they always treat liquids as liquid.

name: Wind Wall
description:
A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 15ft long per Magnitude expended, 15ft high, and 1ft thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the 1 minute duration or until the spell ends.

When the wall appears, each character in its area makes a Fortitude Save, taking 1d8 Bludgeoning damage per Magnitude expended on a failed save and suffer the Prone condition or half as much damage only on a successful one.

The strong wind keeps fog, smoke, and other gases at bay. Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the wall fly upward. Arrows, bolts, and other traditional projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected upward and miss automatically. Boulders hurled by Giants, bullets fired from guns, or bolts launched from siege engines, and similar projectiles, have Disadvantage. Creatures in gaseous form can't pass through it.
